casebody.data:
MENZIES v. CITY OF NEW YORK. (Supreme Court, Appellate Division, Second Department. June 29, 1905.) Appeal from Trial Term, Kings County. Action by Marie R. Menzies against the city of New York. From a judgment for plaintiff, defendant appeals. Reversed.

Argued before HIRSCHBERG, P. J., and BARTLETT, JENKS, RICH, and MILLER, JJ.

John J. Delany, Corp. Counsel (James D. Bill, and James W. Covert, of counsel), for appellant. Ferdinand E. M. Bullowa, for respondent. PER CURIAM.

Judgment and order reversed, and new trial granted, costs to abide the. event, on the authority of Menzies v. Interstate Paving Co. (decided herewith) 94 N. Y. Supp. 492.
